head.supplied: ¶ I do myself the honor to request that His Excellency the Lieutenant Governor will be pleased to authorize me to expend a Sum of Eight hundred pounds in the purchase of Two Greenhouses from Mr Duerd...

div.p: D53/9233, unit 185, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 856 Colonial Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, , Victoria, .

Transcribed 7.9.92. To proof.
See also Ginn to Lonsdale, 5 May 1853; Balmain to Foster, 27 July 1853.
I do myself the honor to request that His Excellency the Lieutenant Governor will be pleased to authorize me to expend a Sum of Eight hundred pounds in the purchase of Two Greenhouses from Mr Duerdin and the cartage of the same to the Botanic Gardens
On 16 September Gilles referred the matter to the Auditor General, Childers, who reported on 28 September: 'The cost was before stated to be £600 not £800 and the former reason is included in the Supp Estimate. But no authority has been issued, although some verbal communications were I think made'. Balmain was asked to: 'explain how price has been raised. it has occurred in several instances lately in his department'. Balmain replied on 5 October: 'The Greenhouses were tendered by Mr Duerdin to the Government at the price paid by him with his expenses thereon; he produced accounts to the amount of £664 before the purchase was approved stating that there was a small account for [...] which he had still to pay and which he would send in; this has been sent to me and amounts to £42.11: making in all £706:11:. The additional amount asked for was to cover the expense for carting, sorting and putting the buildings in such a state that they could be left without risk of injury until funds were voted for their erection.'
MS annotation by unknown, 10 October: 'I presume a verbal authority has been given for this. None other appears'.
La Trobe explained on 11 October: 'I sanctioned the purchase, as there could be no doubt of the advantage to the Institution. If the C. declines to sanction it, I make no doubt but that they may be disposed of'.
